SourceProxy.label: Python Calculator
SourceProxy.name: PythonCalculator

Documentation.long_help: This filter evaluates a Python expression

SourceProxy.Documentation: This filter uses Python to calculate an expression. It depends heavily on the numpy and paraview.vtk modules. To use the parallel functions, mpi4py is also necessary. The expression is evaluated and the resulting scalar value or numpy array is added to the output as an array. See numpy and paraview.vtk documentation for the list of available functions. This filter tries to make it easy for the user to write expressions by defining certain variables. The filter tries to assign each array to a variable of the same name. If the name of the array is not a valid Python variable, it may be accessed through a variable with a sanitized version of that array name consisting of only '_' and the alphanumeric characters in the name joined together with no spaces. Point coordinates from datasets that explicitly define them can be accessed using the variable named 'points'.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: Set the input of the filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: Expression
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The Python expression evaluated during execution.

IntVectorProperty.name: ArrayAssociation
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property controls the association of the output array as well as which arrays are defined as variables.

StringVectorProperty.name: ArrayName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The name of the output array.

IntVectorProperty.name: CopyArrays
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If this property is set to true, all the cell and point arrays from first input are copied to the output.

SourceProxy.label: Annotate Attribute Data
SourceProxy.name: AnnotateAttributeData

Documentation.short_help: Adds a text annotation to a Render View

SourceProxy.Documentation: This filter can be used to add a text annotation to a Render View (or similar) using a tuple from any attribute array (point/cell/field/row etc.) from a specific rank (when running in parallel). Use **ArrayName** property to select the array association and array name. Use **ElementId* property to set the element number to extract the value to label with. When running on multiple ranks, use **ProcessId** property to select the rank of interest. The **Prefix** property can be used to specify a string that will be used as the prefix to the generated annotation text.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: Set the input of the filter. To avoid the complications/confusion when identifying elements in a composite dataset, this filter doesn't support composite datasets currently.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputArray
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property indicates the name of the array from which to obtain the annotation value.

IntVectorProperty.name: ElementId
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the element index to annotate with.

IntVectorProperty.name: ProcessId
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Set the process rank to extract element from.

StringVectorProperty.name: Prefix
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Text that is used as a prefix to the field value

SourceProxy.label: Python Annotation
SourceProxy.name: PythonAnnotation

Documentation.long_help: This filter evaluates a Python expression for a text annotation
Documentation.short_help: Evaluates a Python expression for a text annotation

SourceProxy.Documentation: This filter uses Python to calculate an expression and display the result as an annotation in the render view. It depends heavily on the numpy and paraview.vtk modules. To use the parallel functions, mpi4py is also necessary. The expression is evaluated and the resulting scalar value or numpy array is added to the output as an array. See numpy and paraview.vtk documentation for the list of available functions. This filter tries to make it easy for the user to write expressions by defining certain variables. The filter tries to assign each array to a variable of the same name. If the name of the array is not a valid Python variable, it may be accessed through a variable with a sanitized version of that array name consisting of only '_' and the alphanumeric characters in the name joined together with no spaces. Point coordinates from datasets that explicitly define them can be accessed using the variable named 'points'.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: Set the input of the filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: ArrayAssociation
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Select the attribute to use to populate array names.

StringVectorProperty.name: Expression
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The Python expression evaluated during execution. FieldData arrays are directly available through their name. Set of provided variables [inputs, t_value, t_steps, t_range, t_index, FieldData, PointData, CellData] (i.e.: "Momentum: (%f, %f, %f)" % (XMOM[t_index,0], YMOM[t_index,0], ZMOM[t_index,0]) )

StringVectorProperty.name: AnnotationValue
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: Text that is used as annotation

SourceProxy.label: Programmable Filter
SourceProxy.name: ProgrammableFilter

Documentation.long_help: Executes a user supplied python script on its input dataset to produce an output dataset.
Documentation.short_help: Executes a python script to produce data.

SourceProxy.Documentation: This filter will execute a python script to produce an output dataset. The filter keeps a copy of the python script in Script and creates a python Interpreter to run the script upon the first execution. To execute external python scripts on the ParaView server, use: execfile('full_path/script_name.py'). Documentation is found in the Programmable Filter chapter of the ParaView Guide.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input(s) to the programmable filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: OutputDataSetType
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property determines the dataset type for the output of the programmable filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: Script
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the text of a python program that the programmable filter runs. To execute external python scripts on the ParaView server, use: execfile('full_path/script_name.py'). Documentation is found in the Programmable Filter chapter of the ParaView Guide.

StringVectorProperty.label: RequestInformation Script
StringVectorProperty.name: InformationScript
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property is a python script that is executed during the RequestInformation pipeline pass. Use this to provide information such as WHOLE_EXTENT to the pipeline downstream.

StringVectorProperty.label: RequestUpdateExtent Script
StringVectorProperty.name: UpdateExtentScript
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property is a python script that is executed during the RequestUpdateExtent pipeline pass. Use this to modify the update extent that your filter ask up stream for.

IntVectorProperty.name: CopyArrays
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If this property is set to true, all the cell and point arrays from first input are copied to the output.

StringVectorProperty.name: PythonPath
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: A semi-colon (;) separated list of directories to add to the python library search path.

SourceProxy.label: Programmable Annotation
SourceProxy.name: ProgrammableAnnotation

Documentation.long_help: Executes a user supplied python script on its input dataset to produce an output vtkTable containing a single tuple vtkStringArray to be displayed as a text.
Documentation.short_help: Executes a python script to produce a text.

SourceProxy.Documentation: This filter will execute a python script to produce a text. The text should be contained in a vtkTable containing a single vtkStringArray, itself containing a single tuple. The filter keeps a copy of the python script in Script and creates a python Interpreter to run the script upon the first execution. To execute external python scripts on the ParaView server, use: execfile('full_path/script_name.py'). Documentation is found in the Programmable Filter chapter of the ParaView Guide.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input(s) to the programmable filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: Script
StringVectorProperty.default_values: to = self.GetTableOutput() arr = vtk.vtkStringArray() arr.SetName("Text") arr.SetNumberOfComponents(1) arr.InsertNextValue("YourString") to.AddColumn(arr)
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property contains the text of a python program that the programmable filter runs. To execute external python scripts on the ParaView server, use: execfile('full_path/script_name.py'). Make sure to output a vtkTable containing a single vtkStringArray, itself containing a single tuple

StringVectorProperty.name: PythonPath
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: A semi-colon (;) separated list of directories to add to the python library search path.
